description: Erection of single storey rear extension, partial removal and alterations to roof of existing garage (following demolition of existing rear extension)
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to above ground works, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:20 of the roof lantern rooflight, together with materials and manufacturer(s) specifications, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in strict accordance with the approved drawings and permanently retained as such thereafter.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Condition 8 (Architectural Detailing) - Officers have reviewed the information submitted and are satisfied that the architectural detailing of the balconies, windows, doors, overhangs, rainwater goods, ducts, fans and louvres and their associated reveals and their relationship with the walls/fascias will ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development

Please provide existing and proposed floor plans to show the windows at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.
